verses.verse: וַיְהִי֙ <WH1961> vay-Hi came בַּיָּמִ֣ים <WH3117> bai-ya-Mim And it came to pass in those days הָהֵ֔ם <WH1992> ha-Hem, those וּמֶ֖לֶךְ <WH4428> u-Me-lech when [there was] no king אֵ֣ין <WH369> 'ein there בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל <WH3478> be-Yis-ra-'El; in Israel וַיְהִ֣י׀ <WH1961> vay-Hi came אִ֣ישׁ <WH376> 'ish that there was a certain לֵוִ֗י <WH3881> le-Vi, Levite גָּ֚ר <WH1481> gar sojourning בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֣י <WH3411> be-yar-ke-Tei on the side הַר־ <WH2022> har- of mount אֶפְרַ֔יִם <WH669> 'ef-Ra-yim, Ephraim וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ <WH3947> vai-yik-kach- who took לוֹ֙ lo אִשָּׁ֣ה <WH802> 'ish-Shah ess פִילֶ֔גֶשׁ <WH6370> fi-Le-gesh, A concubine מִבֵּ֥ית mib-Beit לֶ֖חֶם <WH1035> Le-chem Bethlehem יְהוּדָֽה׃ <WH3063> ye-hu-Dah. Judah

וַתִּזְנֶ֤ה <WH2181> vat-tiz-Neh played the whore עָלָיו֙ <WH5921> 'a-Lav against פִּֽילַגְשׁ֔וֹ <WH6370> pi-lag-Sho, And his concubine וַתֵּ֤לֶךְ <WH1980> vat-Te-lech went מֵֽאִתּוֹ֙ <WH853> me-'it-To אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- about בֵּ֣ית <WH1004> beit house אָבִ֔יהָ <WH1> 'a-Vi-ha, from him unto her father's אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- about בֵּ֥ית beit לֶ֖חֶם <WH1035> Le-chem Bethlehem יְהוּדָ֑ה <WH3063> ye-hu-Dah; Judah וַתְּהִי־ <WH1961> vat-te-hi- become שָׁ֕ם <WH8033> sham was there יָמִ֖ים <WH3117> ya-Mim A period אַרְבָּעָ֥ה <WH702> 'ar-ba-'Ah and was there four חֳדָשִֽׁים׃ <WH2320> cho-da-Shim. months

וַיָּ֨קָם <WH6965> vai-Ya-kom arose אִישָׁ֜הּ <WH376> 'i-Shah And her husband וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ <WH1980> vai-Ye-lech and went אַחֲרֶ֗יהָ <WH310> 'a-cha-Rei-ha, after לְדַבֵּ֤ר <WH1696> le-dab-Ber her to speak עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- and לִבָּהּ֙ <WH3820> lib-Bah friendly; לַהֲשִׁיבֹו la-ha-shi-vov כלַהֲשִׁיבָ֔הּ <WH7725> la-ha-shi-Vah, break קוְנַעֲר֥וֹ <WH5288> ve-na-'a-Ro having his servant עִמּ֖וֹ <WH5973> im-Mo and a וְצֶ֣מֶד <WH6776> ve-Tze-med with him and a couple חֲמֹרִ֑ים <WH2543> cha-mo-Rim; of asses וַתְּבִיאֵ֙הוּ֙ <WH935> vat-te-vi-'E-hu and she brought בֵּ֣ית <WH1004> beit house אָבִ֔יהָ <WH1> 'a-Vi-ha, him into her father's וַיִּרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ <WH7200> vai-yir-'E-hu saw אֲבִ֣י <WH1> 'a-Vi and when the father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה <WH5291> han-na-'a-Rah, of the damsel וַיִּשְׂמַ֖ח <WH8055> vai-yis-Mach him he rejoiced לִקְרָאתֽוֹ׃ <WH7125> lik-ra-To. to meet

וַיֶּחֱזַק־ <WH2388> vai-ye-che-zak- retained בּ֤וֹ bo חֹֽתְנוֹ֙ <WH2859> cho-te-No And his father in law אֲבִ֣י <WH1> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה <WH5291> han-na-'a-Rah, the damsel's וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב <WH3427> vai-Ye-shev him and he abode אִתּ֖וֹ <WH854> it-To for שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת <WH7969> she-Lo-shet with him three יָמִ֑ים <WH3117> ya-Mim; days וַיֹּאכְלוּ֙ <WH398> vai-yo-che-Lu so they did eat וַיִּשְׁתּ֔וּ <WH8354> vai-yish-Tu, and drink וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ <WH3885> vai-ya-Li-nu and lodged שָֽׁם׃ <WH8033> Sham. there

וַֽיְהִי֙ <WH1961> vay-Hi become בַּיּ֣וֹם <WH3117> bai-Yom day הָרְבִיעִ֔י <WH7243> ha-re-vi-'I, And it came to pass on the fourth וַיַּשְׁכִּ֥ימוּ <WH7925> vai-yash-Ki-mu when they arose early בַבֹּ֖קֶר <WH1242> vab-Bo-ker in the morning וַיָּ֣קָם <WH6965> vai-Ya-kom that he rose up לָלֶ֑כֶת <WH1980> la-Le-chet; to go וַיֹּאמֶר֩ <WH559> vai-yo-Mer said אֲבִ֨י <WH1> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֜ה <WH5291> han-na-'a-Rah and the damsel's אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- to his חֲתָנ֗וֹ <WH2860> cha-ta-No, unto his son in law סְעָ֧ד <WH5582> se-'Ad Comfort לִבְּךָ֛ <WH3820> lib-be-Cha thine heart פַּת־ <WH6595> pat- with a morsel לֶ֖חֶם <WH3899> Le-chem of bread וְאַחַ֥ר <WH310> ve-'a-Char and afterward תֵּלֵֽכוּ׃ <WH1980> te-Le-chu. may go

וַיֵּשְׁב֗וּ <WH3427> vai-ye-she-Vu, And they sat down וַיֹּאכְל֧וּ <WH398> vai-yo-che-Lu and did eat שְׁנֵיהֶ֛ם <WH8147> she-nei-Hem both יַחְדָּ֖ו <WH3162> yach-Dav of them together וַיִּשְׁתּ֑וּ <WH8354> vai-yish-Tu; and drink וַיֹּ֜אמֶר <WH559> vai-Yo-mer had said אֲבִ֤י <WH1> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָה֙ <WH5291> han-na-'a-Rah for the damsel's אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- to הָאִ֔ישׁ <WH376> ha-'Ish, unto the man הֽוֹאֶל־ <WH2974> ho-'el- Be content נָ֥א <WH4994> na Please וְלִ֖ין <WH3885> ve-Lin I pray thee and tarry all night וְיִטַ֥ב <WH3190> ve-yi-Tav be merry לִבֶּֽךָ׃ <WH3820> lib-Be-cha. and let thine heart

וַיָּ֥קָם <WH6965> vai-Ya-kom rose up הָאִ֖ישׁ <WH376> ha-'Ish And when the man לָלֶ֑כֶת <WH1980> la-Le-chet; to go וַיִּפְצַר־ <WH6484> vai-yif-tzar- urged בּוֹ֙ bo חֹתְנ֔וֹ <WH2859> cho-te-No, his father in law וַיָּ֖שָׁב <WH7725> vai-Ya-shov there again וַיָּ֥לֶן <WH3885> vai-Ya-len him therefore he lodged שָֽׁם׃ <WH8033> Sham. there

וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם <WH7925> vai-yash-Kem And he arose early בַּבֹּ֜קֶר <WH1242> bab-Bo-ker in the morning בַּיּ֣וֹם <WH3117> bai-Yom day הַחֲמִישִׁי֮ <WH2549> ha-cha-mi-Shi on the fifth לָלֶכֶת֒ <WH1980> la-le-Chet to go וַיֹּ֣אמֶר׀ <WH559> vai-Yo-mer said אֲבִ֣י <WH1> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ה <WH5291> han-na-'a-Rah, and the damsel's סְעָד־ <WH5582> se-'od- Comfort נָא֙ <WH4994> na Please לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ <WH3824> le-Va-ve-cha, thine heart וְהִֽתְמַהְמְה֖וּ <WH4102> ve-hit-mah-me-Hu I pray thee And they tarried עַד־ <WH5704> 'ad- until נְט֣וֹת <WH5186> ne-Tot afternoon הַיּ֑וֹם <WH3117> hai-Yom; day וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ <WH398> vai-yo-che-Lu and they did eat שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ <WH8147> she-nei-Hem. both

וַיָּ֤קָם <WH6965> vai-Ya-kom rose up הָאִישׁ֙ <WH376> ha-'Ish And when the man לָלֶ֔כֶת <WH1980> la-Le-chet, that thou mayest go ה֥וּא <WH1931> hu he וּפִילַגְשׁ֖וֹ <WH6370> u-fi-lag-Sho he and his concubine וְנַעֲר֑וֹ <WH5288> ve-na-'a-Ro; and his servant וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> vai-Yo-mer said ל֣וֹ lo חֹתְנ֣וֹ <WH2859> cho-te-No his father in law אֲבִ֣י <WH1> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֡ה <WH5291> han-na-'a-Rah the damsel's הִנֵּ֣ה <WH2009> hin-Neh Behold נָא֩ <WH4994> na now רָפָ֨ה <WH7503> ra-Fah draweth הַיּ֜וֹם <WH3117> hai-Yom unto him Behold now the day לַעֲרֹ֗ב <WH6150> la-'a-Ro, toward evening לִֽינוּ־ <WH3885> li-nu- I pray you tarry all night נָ֞א <WH4994> na please הִנֵּ֨ה <WH2009> hin-Neh Lo חֲנ֤וֹת <WH2583> cha-Not groweth to an end הַיּוֹם֙ <WH3117> hai-yOm behold the day לִ֥ין <WH3885> lin lodge פֹּה֙ <WH6311> poh here וְיִיטַ֣ב <WH3190> ve-yi-Tav may be merry לְבָבֶ֔ךָ <WH3824> le-va-Ve-cha, here that thine heart וְהִשְׁכַּמְתֶּ֤ם <WH7925> ve-hish-kam-Tem get you early מָחָר֙ <WH4279> ma-Char and to morrow לְדַרְכְּכֶ֔ם <WH1870> le-dar-ke-Chem, on your way וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ <WH1980> ve-ha-lach-Ta you may go לְאֹהָלֶֽךָ׃ <WH168> le-'o-ha-Le-cha. home

וְלֹֽא־ <WH3808> ve-lo- was not אָבָ֤ה <WH14> 'a-Vah would הָאִישׁ֙ <WH376> ha-'Ish But the man לָל֔וּן <WH3885> la-Lun, not tarry that night וַיָּ֣קָם <WH6965> vai-Ya-kom but he rose up וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ <WH1980> vai-Ye-lech, and departed וַיָּבֹא֙ <WH935> vai-ya-Vo and came עַד־ <WH5704> 'ad- to נֹ֣כַח <WH5227> No-chach over against יְב֔וּס <WH2982> ye-Vus, Jebus הִ֖יא <WH1931> hi he יְרוּשָׁלִָ֑ם <WH3389> ye-ru-sha-Lim; which [is] Jerusalem וְעִמּ֗וֹ <WH5973> ve-'im-Mo, with צֶ֤מֶד <WH6776> Tze-med and [there were] with him two חֲמוֹרִים֙ <WH2543> cha-mo-Rim asses חֲבוּשִׁ֔ים <WH2280> cha-vu-Shim, saddled וּפִילַגְשׁ֖וֹ <WH6370> u-fi-lag-Sho his concubine עִמּֽוֹ׃ <WH5973> im-Mo. with

הֵ֣ם <WH1992> hem When עִם־ <WH5973> 'im- they near יְב֔וּס <WH2982> ye-Vus, [And] when they [were] by Jebus וְהַיּ֖וֹם <WH3117> ve-hai-Yom the day רַ֣ד <WH7286> rad spent מְאֹ֑ד <WH3966> me-'Od; was far וַיֹּ֨אמֶר <WH559> vai-Yo-mer said הַנַּ֜עַר <WH5288> han-Na-'ar and the servant אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- to his אֲדֹנָ֗יו <WH113> 'a-do-Nav, unto his master לְכָה־ <WH1980> le-chah- come נָּ֛א <WH4994> na Please וְנָס֛וּרָה <WH5493> ve-na-Su-rah I pray thee and let us turn in אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- about עִֽיר־ <WH5892> 'ir- into this city הַיְבוּסִ֥י <WH2983> hay-vu-Si of the Jebusites הַזֹּ֖את <WH2063> haz-Zot likewise וְנָלִ֥ין <WH3885> ve-na-Lin and lodge בָּֽהּ׃ Bah.

וַיֹּ֤אמֶר <WH559> vai-Yo-mer said אֵלָיו֙ <WH413> 'e-Lav about אֲדֹנָ֔יו <WH113> 'a-do-Nav, And his master לֹ֤א <WH3808> lo We will not נָסוּר֙ <WH5493> na-Sur unto him We will not turn aside אֶל־ <WH413> 'el- into עִ֣יר <WH5892> 'ir hither into the city נָכְרִ֔י <WH5237> na-che-Ri, of a stranger אֲשֶׁ֛ר <WH834> 'a-Sher who לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lo- are not מִבְּנֵ֥י <WH1121> mib-be-Nei that [is] not of the children יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל <WH3478> Yis-ra-'El of Israel הֵ֑נָּה <WH2008> Hen-nah; here וְעָבַ֖רְנוּ <WH5674> ve-'a-Var-nu we will pass over עַד־ <WH5704> 'ad- far גִּבְעָֽה׃ <WH1390> giv-'Ah. to Gibeah

וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> vai-Yo-mer And he said לְנַעֲר֔וֹ <WH5288> le-na-'a-Ro, unto his servant לְךָ֥ <WH1980> le-Cha Come וְנִקְרְבָ֖ה <WH7126> ve-nik-re-Vah and let us draw near בְּאַחַ֣ד <WH259> be-'a-Chad to one הַמְּקֹמ֑וֹת <WH4725> ham-me-ko-Mot; of these places וְלַ֥נּוּ <WH3885> ve-Lan-nu to lodge all night בַגִּבְעָ֖ה <WH1390> vag-giv-'Ah in Gibeah א֥וֹ <WH176> o or בָרָמָֽה׃ <WH7414> va-ra-Mah. or in Ramah

וַיַּעַבְר֖וּ <WH5674> vai-ya-'av-Ru And they passed on וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ <WH1980> vai-ye-Le-chu; and went וַתָּבֹ֤א <WH935> vat-ta-Vo went down לָהֶם֙ la-Hem הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ <WH8121> hash-She-mesh, and the sun אֵ֥צֶל <WH681> 'E-tzel upon them [when they were] by הַגִּבְעָ֖ה <WH1390> hag-giv-'Ah Gibeah אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> 'a-Sher which לְבִנְיָמִֽן׃ <WH1144> le-vin-ya-Min. which [belongeth] to Benjamin

וַיָּסֻ֣רוּ <WH5493> vai-ya-Su-ru And they turned aside שָׁ֔ם <WH8033> Sham, there לָב֖וֹא <WH935> la-Vo thither to go in לָל֣וּן <WH3885> la-Lun [and] to lodge בַּגִּבְעָ֑ה <WH1390> bag-giv-'Ah; in Gibeah וַיָּבֹ֗א <WH935> vai-ya-Vo, and when he went in וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ <WH3427> vai-Ye-shev he sat him down בִּרְח֣וֹב <WH7339> bir-Chov in a street הָעִ֔יר <WH5892> ha-'Ir, of the city וְאֵ֥ין <WH369> ve-'Ein no אִ֛ישׁ <WH376> 'ish for [there was] no man מְאַסֵּֽף־ <WH622> me-'as-sef- that took אוֹתָ֥ם <WH853> o-Tam הַבַּ֖יְתָה <WH1004> hab-Bay-tah them into his house לָלֽוּן׃ <WH3885> la-Lun. to lodging

וְהִנֵּ֣ה׀ <WH2009> ve-hin-Neh behold אִ֣ישׁ <WH376> 'ish man זָקֵ֗ן <WH2205> za-Ken, an old בָּ֣א <WH935> ba And behold there came מִֽן־ <WH4480> min- from מַעֲשֵׂ֤הוּ <WH4639> ma-'a-Se-hu from his work מִן־ <WH4480> min- out הַשָּׂדֶה֙ <WH7704> has-sa-Deh out of the field בָּעֶ֔רֶב <WH6153> ba-'E-rev, at even וְהָאִישׁ֙ <WH376> ve-ha-'Ish which [was] also מֵהַ֣ר <WH2022> me-Har of mount אֶפְרַ֔יִם <WH669> 'ef-Ra-yim, Ephraim וְהוּא־ <WH1931> ve-hu- and he גָ֖ר <WH1481> gar and he sojourned בַּגִּבְעָ֑ה <WH1390> bag-giv-'Ah; in Gibeah וְאַנְשֵׁ֥י <WH376> ve-'an-Shei the men הַמָּק֖וֹם <WH4725> ham-ma-Kom of the place בְּנֵ֥י be-Nei יְמִינִֽי׃ <WH1145> ye-mi-Ni. [were] Benjamites
